instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2914 MacBook Pro 17
threads.message: I have a MacBook Pro 17 2011 doesn't turn on, fan spin for one second, what are the first voltages to check?

threads.title: 820-2914 MacBook Pro 17
threads.message: History of the device? Was the GPU messed with?

threads.title: 820-2914 MacBook Pro 17
threads.message: yes, the Gpu was reflowed. After last reflow it does one second fan spin. Can a shorted Gpu cause this kind of problem or the fan should not spin at all?

threads.title: 820-2914 MacBook Pro 17
threads.message:
Yeah probably the GPU is shorted or VRAM, especially if the edge bonding glue was not removed.

Reflow is no solution and will not fix anything, it will either make it work for a few weeks or just kill it.

threads.title: 820-2914 MacBook Pro 17
threads.message: do yourself a favour and do what I do, don't touch 2011 at all, not even parts replacements
